alert.note: Alert for Van Buren (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 19 at 1:04AM CDT until September 19 at 1:45AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM CDT FOR CENTRAL HANCOCK...SOUTHEASTERN VAN BUREN...SOUTHWESTERN LEE AND NORTHEASTERN CLARK COUNTIES... At 103 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Shimek State Forest, or 14 miles north of Kahoka, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tennis ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. This severe storm will be near... Donnellson, Franklin and Lee County Fairgrounds around 110 AM CDT. Charleston and Wilson Lake around 115 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include New Boston, Argyle, Vincennes, Nauvoo, Montrose, St. Francisville, Summitville, Keokuk Airport, Mooar, Galland, Bluff Park, Nauvoo State Park, Keokuk, Sandusky, Camp Eastman, Chatfield Park, Warsaw, Alexandria and Hamilton. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
